TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class ToolTask : Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task, Microsoft.Build.Framework.ICancelableTask
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ToolTask extends Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task implements class Microsoft.Build.Framework.ICancelableTask, class Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived form, provides functionality for a task that wraps a command line tool.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This abstract class provides default implementations for the methods and properties of a task that wraps a command line tool.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask> that runs [Ilasm.exe (IL Assembler)](~/docs/framework/tools/ilasm-exe-il-assembler.md). The <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.CommandLineBuilder>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolLocationHelper>, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper> classes are used to generate the information needed to run the task.
[!code-csharp[msbuild_ToolTask#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Misc/msbuild_ToolTask/CS/ILAsm.cs#1)] [!code-vb[msbuild_ToolTask#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Misc/msbuild_ToolTask/VB/ILAsm.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Calls the host object to perform the work of the task.
Docs.returns: if the method was successfule; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Cancel() cil managed

Docs.summary: Cancels the process executing the task by asking it to close nicely, then after a short period, forcing termination.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void DeleteTempFile(string fileName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the temporary file to delete.
Docs.summary: Deletes the specified temporary file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the delete operation fails for any reason (such as if a file is locked by antivirus software), then this method logs a warning rather than throwing an exception, which would cause the build to fail.

Docs.summary: Indicates that command line echoing is turned off.
Docs.value: True when command line echo is off.

remarks.format: ## Remarks MSBuild turns off command line echoing by passing /Q on the cmd.exe command line.

Docs.summary: Gets a set of environment variable name-value pairs. Designed to be overridden in a custom task class (derived from ToolTask) to return a set of new or altered environment variables to create the execution context of the associated tool.
Docs.value: Returns a set of environment variables. Each dictionary key is the name of the environment variable to override and the dictionary value is the value to set for that environment variable. The default implementation of EnvironmentOverride returns null.

Docs.summary: Array of equals-separated pairs of environment variables that should be passed to the spawned executable, in addition to (or selectively overriding) the regular environment block.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Using this instead of EnvironmentOverride as that takes a StringDictionary, which cannot be set from an MSBuild project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Execute() cil managed

Docs.summary: Runs the exectuable file with the specified task parameters.
Docs.returns: if the task runs successfully; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual int ExecuteTool (string pathToTool, string responseFileCommands, string commandLineCommands);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 ExecuteTool(string pathToTool, string responseFileCommands, string commandLineCommands) cil managed

Docs.param: The path to the executable file.
The command line arguments to place in the .rsp file.
The command line arguments to pass directly to the executable file.
Docs.summary: Creates a temporoary response (.rsp) file and runs the executable file.
Docs.returns: The returned exit code of the executable file. If the task logged errors, but the executable returned an exit code of 0, this method returns -1.

Docs.summary: Gets the returned exit code of the executable file.
Docs.value: The returned exit code of the executable file. If the task logged errors, but the executable returned an exit code of 0, this method returns -1.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string GenerateCommandLineCommands() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string value containing the command line arguments to pass directly to the executable file.
Docs.returns: A string value containing the command line arguments to pass directly to the executable file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called after <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask.ValidateParameters%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask.SkipTaskExecution%2A>.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask> that runs [Ilasm.exe (IL Assembler)](~/docs/framework/tools/ilasm-exe-il-assembler.md). The <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.CommandLineBuilder>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolLocationHelper>, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper> classes are used to generate the information needed to run the task.

Docs.summary: Returns the fully qualified path to the executable file.
Docs.returns: The fully qualified path to the executable file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method returns the value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask.ToolName%2A> property if the tool is located in the system path.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask> that runs [Ilasm.exe (IL Assembler)](~/docs/framework/tools/ilasm-exe-il-assembler.md). The <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.CommandLineBuilder>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolLocationHelper>, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper> classes are used to generate the information needed to run the task.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string GenerateResponseFileCommands() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string value containing the command line arguments to add to the response (.rsp) file before running the executable file.
Docs.returns: a string value containing the command line arguments to add to the response (.rsp) file before running the executable file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called after <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask.ValidateParameters%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask.SkipTaskExecution%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: protected System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo GetProcessStartInfo (string pathToTool, string commandLineCommands, string responseFileSwitch);
.method familyhidebysig instance class System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo GetProcessStartInfo(string pathToTool, string commandLineCommands, string responseFileSwitch) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes the information required to spawn the process executing the tool.
Docs.returns: The information required to start the process.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetResponseFileSwitch(string responseFilePath) cil managed

Docs.param: The full path to the temporary .rsp file.
Docs.summary: Returns the command line switch used by the executable file to specifiy a response (.rsp) file.
Docs.returns: The command line switch used by the executable file to specifiy a response (.rsp) file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is only called if <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask.GenerateResponseFileCommands%2A> returns a non-empty string value.
This method is called after <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask.ValidateParameters%2A>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask.SkipTaskExecution%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask.GenerateResponseFileCommands%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetWorkingDirectory() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the directory in which to run the executable file.
Docs.returns: The directory in which to run the executable file, or a null reference ( in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]) if the executable file should be run in the current directory.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is a method rather than a property so that derived classes (like Exec) can choose to expose a public WorkingDirectory property, and it would be confusing to have two properties.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool HandleTaskExecutionErrors() cil managed

Docs.summary: Handles execution errors raised by the executable file.
Docs.returns: if the method runs successfully; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called only if the executable file returns a non-zero exit code.
The return value of this method is used as the return value of the task.

Docs.summary: Whether this ToolTask has logged any errors

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Microsoft.Build.Utilities.HostObjectInitializationStatus InitializeHostObject() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes the host object of the task.

Docs.param: A single line of text for the method to parse.
A value of that indicates the importance level with which to log the message.
Docs.summary: Parses a single line of text to identify any errors or warnings in canonical format.

Should ALL messages received on the standard error stream be logged as errors.

Docs.summary: Logs the starting point of the run to all registered loggers.
Gets the of the response file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The encoding is <xref:System.Text.Encoding.UTF8%2A> by default.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string ResponseFileEscape(string responseString) cil managed

Docs.summary: Overridable method to escape the content of the response file.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool SkipTaskExecution() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates whether task execution should be skipped.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called after <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask.ValidateParameters%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets the of the standard error stream of the task.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Console-based output uses the current system OEM code page by default. Note that we should not use Console.OutputEncoding here since processes we run don't really have much to do with our console window (and also Console.OutputEncoding doesn't return the OEM code page if the running application that hosts MSBuild is not a console application).

Docs.summary: Task Parameter: Importance with which to log text from the standard error stream.
Gets the actual importance at which standard error messages will be logged.
Docs.value: Returns the actual importance at which standard error messages will be logged.

Docs.summary: Gets the with which to log errors.
Docs.value: The with which to log errors.

Docs.summary: Gets the of the standard output stream of the task.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Console-based output uses the current system OEM code page by default. Note that we should not use Console.OutputEncoding here since processes we run don't really have much to do with our console window (and also Console.OutputEncoding doesn't return the OEM code page if the running application that hosts MSBuild is not a console application).

Docs.summary: Task Parameter: Importance with which to log text from the standard out stream.
Gets the actual importance at which standard out messages will be logged.
Docs.value: Returns the actual importance at which standard out messages will be logged.

Docs.summary: Gets the with which to log errors.
Docs.value: The with which to log errors.

Docs.summary: A timeout to wait for a task to terminate before killing it. In milliseconds.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int Timeout { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time after which the task executable is terminated.
Used to signal when a tool has been cancelled.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string ToolExe { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Projects may set this to override a task's ToolName. Tasks may override this to prevent that.
Gets the name of the executable file to run.
Docs.value: The name of the executable file to run.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolTask> that runs [Ilasm.exe (IL Assembler)](~/docs/framework/tools/ilasm-exe-il-assembler.md). The <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.CommandLineBuilder>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ToolLocationHelper>, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper> classes are used to generate the information needed to run the task.
[!code-csharp[msbuild_ToolTask#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Misc/msbuild_ToolTask/CS/ILAsm.cs#1)] [!code-vb[msbuild_ToolTask#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Misc/msbuild_ToolTask/VB/ILAsm.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the path of the executable file to run.
Docs.value: The path of the file to run.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a switch that specifies whether the tool task will create a batch file for the command-line and execute that using the command-processor, rather than executing the command directly.
Docs.value: If true, the tool task will create a batch file for the command-line and execute that using the command-processor. If false the tool task will execute the command directly.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ValidateParameters() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates whether all task paratmeters are valid.
Docs.returns: if all task parameters are valid; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Indicates if the task will yield the node during tool execution.
Docs.value: True when the task will yield the node during tool execution.
